Zandu Giloy Tablets.evidence: Multiple case series in India have linked T. cordifolia (giloy) to herb-induced liver injury (HILI), particularly during the COVID-19 period.

supplementary_links.title: Case report of Giloy-induced liver injury (PubMed)

Himalaya Turmeric 95.evidence: Generally considered safe, but rare case reports of liver injury exist, especially with high-bioavailability formulations. The TGA (Australia) issued a safety advisory.

Herbal Stress Relief.evidence: Well-documented link to severe hepatotoxicity, leading to regulatory warnings or bans in several countries.

Focus Boost.evidence: Considered largely safe, but isolated case reports of mild liver injury have been published. Caution is advised.

Ginger Soothe Capsules.evidence: Widely recognized as safe (GRAS) with no significant evidence of hepatotoxicity in standard doses.
